name: South Twin Mountain

trails_config.name: Gale River & Twinway Trail
trails_config.description: A long approach via Gale River Trail to Galehead Hut, then a steep final climb up Twinway to the summit. The summit of South Twin rewards with one of the best 360° views in the Whites, including a stunning perspective on the surrounding Pemigewasset Wilderness.
trails_config.parking_info: Gale River Trailhead, Gale River Loop Rd

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on South Twin Mountain. At 4902 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4902 feet, South Twin Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Gale River & Twinway Trail**, a **11.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Bond**, which is just 0.8 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.

logistics.parking_info: Gale River Trailhead, Gale River Loop Rd
